connector.description: Interact with Ignite Queue data structures.

camel.sink.endpoint.configuration.name: camel.sink.endpoint.configuration
camel.sink.endpoint.configuration.description: The collection configuration. Default: empty configuration. You can also conveniently set inner properties by using configuration.xyz=123 options.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to invoke on the Ignite Queue. Superseded by the IgniteConstants.IGNITE_QUEUE_OPERATION header in the IN message. Possible values: CONTAINS, ADD, SIZE, REMOVE, ITERATOR, CLEAR, RETAIN_ALL, ARRAY, DRAIN, ELEMENT, PEEK, OFFER, POLL, TAKE, PUT. One of: [CONTAINS] [ADD] [SIZE] [REMOVE] [ITERATOR] [CLEAR] [RETAIN_ALL] [ARRAY] [DRAIN] [ELEMENT] [PEEK] [OFFER] [POLL] [TAKE] [PUT]

camel.sink.endpoint.propagateIncomingBod.name: camel.sink.endpoint.propagateIncomingBodyIfNoReturnValue
camel.sink.endpoint.propagateIncomingBod.description: Sets whether to propagate the incoming body if the return type of the underlying Ignite operation is void.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeoutMillis.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeoutMillis
camel.sink.endpoint.timeoutMillis.description: The queue timeout in milliseconds. Default: no timeout.

camel.sink.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCa.name: camel.sink.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCacheObjects
camel.sink.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCa.description: Sets whether to treat Collections as cache objects or as Collections of items to insert/update/compute, etc.

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.ignite-queue.configurati.name: camel.component.ignite-queue.configurationResource
camel.component.ignite-queue.configurati.description: The resource from where to load the configuration. It can be a: URL, String or InputStream type.

camel.component.ignite-queue.ignite.name: camel.component.ignite-queue.ignite
camel.component.ignite-queue.ignite.description: To use an existing Ignite instance.

camel.component.ignite-queue.igniteConfi.name: camel.component.ignite-queue.igniteConfiguration
camel.component.ignite-queue.igniteConfi.description: Allows the user to set a programmatic ignite configuration.

camel.component.ignite-queue.lazyStartPr.name: camel.component.ignite-queue.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.ignite-queue.lazyStartPr.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.ignite-queue.autowiredEn.name: camel.component.ignite-queue.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.ignite-queue.autowiredEn.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
